meanings.definition: A person who has converted from one opinion, religion, or party to another.
meanings.sent1: The proselyte was once a staunch supporter of the opposing team.
meanings.sent2: The new proselyte brought fresh ideas to the discussion.
meanings.sent3: The proselyte's switch in political allegiance raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: Becoming a proselyte of the environmental movement opened her eyes to new perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The proselyte's journey from skepticism to belief was inspiring.

meanings.definition: To convert or attempt to convert someone to a different opinion, religion, or party.
meanings.sent1: She tried to proselyte her friend to join the book club.
meanings.sent2: The missionaries sought to proselyte the villagers to their faith.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly attempted to proselyte his cat to become a dog lover.
meanings.sent4: The marketing team aimed to proselyte customers to switch brands.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's passion for science was infectious, proselyting many students to pursue STEM fields.
